episodeTitle: Destruction of the Straw Hat Pirates? The Terror of the Model Leopard!
episodeTitleJapanese: 麦わら一味壊滅!? モデル豹の恐怖
episodeTitleRomanized: Mugiwara Ichimi Kaimetsu!? Moderu Hyō no Kyōfu
description: Rob Lucci reveals his Devil Fruit power, the Neko Neko no Mi Model Leopard, and transforms into a fearsome leopard-human hybrid. He swiftly defeats Luffy and Zoro, sending them into the sea, while incapacitating Nami. CP9 leaves Paulie and Iceburg tied up as the Galley-La headquarters burns. Meanwhile, Usopp shares his story with Franky in his underground hideout, moving the cyborg to tears as he learns about Usopp's falling out with the crew over the Going Merry.

events.title: Rob Lucci's Leopard Transformation Revealed
events.description: Rob Lucci reveals his Devil Fruit ability for the first time, transforming into a leopard-human hybrid using the Neko Neko no Mi, Model: Leopard. His appearance changes dramatically as he gains enhanced physical strength, sharp claws, retractable fangs, and spotted leopard fur covering his body.
events.significance: This is the first clear demonstration of Lucci's true power and the reveal of his Zoan-type Devil Fruit. It establishes him as one of the most formidable opponents the Straw Hats have faced, showing the massive power gap between the crew and CP9's strongest member. This transformation marks the beginning of the crew's devastating defeat.

events.title: Lucci Defeats Luffy and Zoro
events.description: Using his enhanced leopard strength and Rokushiki techniques, Rob Lucci swiftly overpowers both Luffy and Zoro. With devastating attacks, he sends both of them flying out of the building and into the sea below, leaving them unconscious and unable to continue fighting.
events.significance: This represents one of the Straw Hats' most complete defeats up to this point in the series. The fact that both Luffy and Zoro, the crew's two strongest fighters, are taken down so easily demonstrates the overwhelming power of CP9 and establishes the high stakes for the upcoming Enies Lobby arc.

events.title: Nami Thrown Out the Window
events.description: After defeating the male crew members, Rob Lucci knocks out Nami and throws her out of the window of the Galley-La headquarters, leaving her unconscious outside the burning building.
events.significance: Completes the total defeat of all present Straw Hat members, showing that CP9 has completely outmatched the crew. This adds to the desperate situation as the crew is scattered and defeated.

events.title: Chopper Buried Under Rubble
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper is buried under the rubble inside the Galley-La headquarters as the building continues to burn. He remains trapped and unconscious, unable to help his crewmates or the other victims.
events.significance: Leaves Chopper in a life-threatening situation that will need to be resolved in the next episode. His position as the crew's doctor makes his incapacitation particularly concerning.

events.title: CP9 Leaves Paulie and Iceburg to Die
events.description: After interrogating them and confirming they don't have the Pluton blueprints, CP9 ties up Paulie and Iceburg, leaving them bound and unconscious in the burning Galley-La headquarters. The building has been set ablaze with a firebomb, and the two are left to perish in the flames.
events.significance: Demonstrates CP9's ruthlessness and willingness to kill without hesitation. This attempted murder of Iceburg, the mayor of Water 7, and Paulie, a beloved shipwright, shows how far the World Government is willing to go to obtain the Pluton blueprints.

events.title: Lucci Uses Rankyaku to Bisect the Mansion
events.description: Rob Lucci demonstrates the devastating power of his Rokushiki technique Rankyaku (Storm Leg) by launching a compressed air blade so powerful that it cuts the entire Galley-La headquarters building in half. This keeps the arriving Galley-La members at bay and prevents them from reaching Iceburg.
events.significance: First demonstration of Lucci's mastery of Rokushiki techniques and the first time Rankyaku is shown with such destructive capability. This establishes Lucci as not just a Devil Fruit user, but also a master martial artist with superhuman abilities.

events.title: CP9 Confirms Their Next Target: Franky
events.description: After failing to obtain the Pluton blueprints from Iceburg, Rob Lucci states that their next job is to retrieve the blueprints from Tom's second disciple, Franky (Cutty Flam). This reveals that CP9 knows about Franky's connection to Tom and the blueprints.
events.significance: Shifts the focus of CP9's mission to Franky, making him the key figure in the Pluton blueprints storyline. This sets up Franky's importance to the overall arc and foreshadows his eventual role with the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: Our next job is to retrieve the blueprints from Tom's second disciple, Franky.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: After confirming Iceburg doesn't have the Pluton blueprints

events.title: Usopp Tells Franky His Story
events.description: In Franky's underground hideout, Usopp opens up to Franky about his falling out with the Straw Hat crew over the Going Merry. He explains how he disagreed with Luffy's decision to replace the ship, leading to their fight and his departure from the crew. Usopp's emotional story moves Franky to tears.
events.significance: This is a crucial character moment for Usopp as he processes his pain and uncertainty about leaving the crew. Franky's emotional response shows his deep connection to ships and sets up their bond. This conversation is the beginning of Usopp and Franky's relationship and understanding.

events.title: Franky Tells Usopp About Tom's Contributions
events.description: After hearing Usopp's story, Franky reciprocates by sharing information about Tom, the legendary shipwright who built the Oro Jackson (Gol D. Roger's ship) and made significant contributions to Water 7's development. Franky explains Tom's importance to the city and his legacy.
events.significance: Provides important background information about Tom, setting up the flashback arc that will explain Franky's past, his relationship with Tom, and the origin of the Pluton blueprints. This establishes the thematic connection between Usopp's love for the Going Merry and Franky's relationship with his mentor.

events.title: Franky Mentions the Klabautermann
events.description: During their conversation about ships, Franky begins to explain the concept of the Klabautermann to Usopp - the ship spirit that appears when a vessel is greatly loved and cared for by its crew. This validates Usopp's experience of seeing a mysterious figure repair the Going Merry on Skypiea.
events.significance: Confirms that Usopp's encounter with the mysterious figure on Skypiea was real and introduces the folklore of the Klabautermann. This adds a supernatural/spiritual element to the Going Merry's story and foreshadows the ship's eventual farewell.

events.title: Franky Shows Emotional Depth
events.description: After hearing Usopp's story about the Going Merry and his falling out with the crew, Franky breaks down in tears. Despite his tough exterior and status as a pirate ship dismantler, he reveals a soft heart and deep understanding of the bond between a crew and their ship.
events.significance: Provides important character development for Franky, showing that beneath his eccentric and aggressive persona lies someone who deeply understands and values the relationship between ships and their crews. This emotional moment foreshadows his eventual joining of the Straw Hats.

events.title: Galley-La Members Arrive at Burning Headquarters
events.description: Members of the Galley-La Company arrive at their headquarters to discover the building is on fire and the first floor has been set ablaze. They rush upstairs to check on Iceburg, only to be stopped by Lucci's Rankyaku technique that cuts the building in half.
events.significance: Shows the aftermath of CP9's attack and the chaos it has caused in Water 7. The Galley-La members' attempts to save their boss are thwarted by CP9's overwhelming power.

quotes.text: Our next job is to retrieve the blueprints from Tom's second disciple, Franky.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: After confirming Iceburg doesn't have the Pluton blueprints

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the vast power difference between the Straw Hats and CP9, particularly Rob Lucci. The crew's complete defeat demonstrates they are not yet ready to face the World Government's elite.
themes.symbolism: Lucci's leopard transformation symbolizes the predatory nature of the World Government and its willingness to hunt down threats with overwhelming force.

themes.theme: The Bond Between Ships and Crews
themes.description: Through the parallel stories of Usopp's love for the Going Merry and Franky's understanding of ship spirits, the episode explores the deep emotional connection between sailors and their vessels.
themes.symbolism: The Klabautermann represents the soul that a ship develops when truly loved and cared for, reflecting the Straw Hats' deep bond with the Going Merry.
culturalReferences: The Klabautermann is based on German maritime folklore about protective ship spirits

themes.description: CP9's willingness to kill Iceburg and Paulie, respected figures in Water 7, demonstrates the World Government's complete lack of mercy in pursuing its goals.
themes.symbolism: The burning Galley-La headquarters represents the destruction the World Government leaves in its wake when seeking ancient weapons.

themes.description: Franky's tough exterior masks a deeply emotional and understanding person who can connect with Usopp's pain. Both characters reveal vulnerability to each other.
themes.symbolism: Franky's tears symbolize the breaking down of emotional barriers and the beginning of genuine connection.

characterSpotlights.development: Lucci's true power is revealed as he transforms into his leopard form and easily defeats multiple Straw Hats. His cold efficiency and overwhelming strength establish him as one of the most dangerous enemies the crew has faced.
keyActions: Reveals Neko Neko no Mi Model Leopard transformation
Defeats both Luffy and Zoro simultaneously
Knocks out Nami and throws her from the building
Uses Rankyaku to bisect the Galley-La headquarters
Leaves Paulie and Iceburg to die in the burning building
Announces Franky as the next target
quotes: Our next job is to retrieve the blueprints from Tom's second disciple, Franky.

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp opens up about his painful separation from the crew and his love for the Going Merry. His vulnerability in sharing his story with Franky shows his emotional growth and need for understanding.
keyActions: Shares his story with Franky about leaving the crew
Explains his conflict with Luffy over the Going Merry
Learns about Tom's contributions to Water 7
Hears about the Klabautermann from Franky

characterSpotlights.development: Franky shows unexpected emotional depth, crying after hearing Usopp's story. He demonstrates wisdom about ships and their spirits, revealing his connection to maritime tradition and his mentor Tom.
keyActions: Listens to Usopp's story and is moved to tears
Shares information about Tom's legacy
Explains the concept of the Klabautermann
Shows empathy and understanding toward Usopp's situation

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy experiences a devastating defeat at the hands of Rob Lucci, being sent into the sea and left unable to save his crew or the people of Water 7.
keyActions: Fights Rob Lucci
Is defeated and sent flying into the sea
Left unconscious and unable to help

characterSpotlights.development: Even Zoro, one of the crew's strongest fighters, is easily overwhelmed by Lucci's power, emphasizing the strength gap.
keyActions: Fights Rob Lucci alongside Luffy
Is defeated and sent into the sea
Left unconscious

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended some scenes of the Galley-La headquarters burning and the emotional conversation between Franky and Usopp for pacing purposes.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode to use 'Dear Friends' by TRIPLANE as the ending theme. The song is dedicated to the Going Merry and later plays during the ship's funeral in Episode 312.
Episode 246 achieved a TV rating of 16.7% in Japan, ranking #1 in its timeslot, showing high viewer interest in the CP9 reveal arc.
The Neko Neko no Mi, Model: Leopard was first shown in silhouette in Episode 245, creating a cliffhanger that was resolved in this episode.
This episode features the second eyecatchers for Sanji and Usopp, updating their character designs.
Rob Lucci's leopard form is a hybrid transformation, one of the three standard forms available to Zoan-type Devil Fruit users (human, hybrid, and full beast).
The Klabautermann is based on real German maritime folklore about a spirit that lives on ships and appears to the crew in times of need or danger.
This episode is part of the Water 7 Arc, which is widely considered one of the best arcs in One Piece for its character development, emotional depth, and well-crafted villains.
